text: most people unfortunately fail when it
comes to stir frying at home but it's
really easy to do you just need to know
a few tricks and tips and you will have
successful stir frying at home I promise
now if you have one of these great walks
like I do this is a steel wok it's
pretty thin but it really does conduct a
lot of heat and that's really what you
need when your stir frying you need a
high high high heat if you don't have a
wok like this at home you could
certainly use a cast iron skillet like I
have here or even a fry pan which has a
nice amount of surface area which will
give you really great browning and
that's what you're looking for so today
I'm going to be making a pork stir-fry
with broccolini and carrots but really
you can mix this up with any different
type of proteins or vegetables I'm going
to start with a flavorful marinade for
the pork so I have two teaspoons of
cornstarch and cornstarch really helps
in thickening the marinade which
ultimately will end up as the sauce for
your stir-fry this is two teaspoons of
dry sherry which adds really great
flavor and I'm going to add one
tablespoon of soy sauce now one of the
most common problems people have when
their stir frying is that the end up
with a watery stir fry something that
almost steams instead of fries and so a
way to avoid excess moisture is to add
cornstarch to your marinade because what
that does is it thickens during the
cooking process
and it eliminates any loose extra
moisture so this mixture here goes right
on to 12 ounces of pork tenderloin and
this just really needs to sit and
marinate for about 10 minutes so while
your pork is marinating you want to make
sure that your knees on cloths or ready
all of your vegetables that you're going
to be stir frying so in front of me here
I'm using broccolini today this is one
big bunch of broccolini about 8 ounces
you want to make sure that your pieces
are all evenly cut so that they cook at
the same rate I have two carrots that
are cut into a nice julienne like this
and I have two scallions cut into one
inch sticks here to start with a
stir-fry I'm using a wok again and I
have this cranked up to the highest heat
setting you really need your wok to be
at its highest temperature possible and
to test whether or not it's super hot
you can take a little bit of water and
splash it in the pan and it should pop
up and dance and almost immediately
evaporate so our wok is super hot it's
ready to go now
what you need here is a tablespoon of
oil and since our wok is so hot you need
a high heat oil so make sure that you
use a neutral flavored oil that has a
high smoke point like safflower oil
grapeseed oil even peanut oil has a
really high smoke point and what you
want to do you want to make sure that
you're not overcrowding your wok that is
one of the most important things if you
overcrowd the wok what you're doing is
you're steaming everything and you're
not getting a good here so if you have
to do this in batches do it in batches
so I'm gonna take half of this pork
mixture and scatter it in the bottom of
the pan in an even layer and do not do
what you want to do which is something
we always tend to do with meats and
stuff that we're grilling is try and
move the pork because what you want to
do here is get a good sear so leave it
for about a minute to get a nice sear on
one side and then you can start moving
the pork around the pan so you can see
that the pork is starting to become
opaque around the edges and this is when
you know that you can start moving the
pork around because it's created a nice
sear and it should come off the pan
easily move the walk around move the
spoon around
so the pork is nicely seared and now
what you're going to do is just scrape
this out onto a plate and so now for the
second batch of pork oil again pork goes
in and now you can add the aromatic so I
have Orlick that I finally mince I have
some ginger that I've cut into you a
nice matchstick size and to Thai bird
chilies so the pork looks nice and
cooked through this goes right on to the
plate here now you want to reheat the
wok and if there's any little bits of
garlic or anything else that would burn
during reheating you can just take a
cloth to this and kind of scrape up
those bits so now bring this back up to
the highest temperature possible again
before you add your vegetables so I
think our wok is hot enough it's smoking
the water is bubbling and popping almost
evaporating add a little bit more oil
and now what you want to do with your
vegetables is start with the biggest
pieces of vegetables so add your
broccolini and a nice even layer you can
hear right away that it's cooking at a
high high heat all of that sizzling and
that's what you want add a little bit of
salt and give this a stir so shake the
pan move the broccolini up along the
sides of the pan so the broccolini is
just starting to turn a wonderful
emerald color you can see it's getting
really shiny I'm gonna move it up to the
sides of the wok leaving a space in the
very center now if your pan seems a
little dry add a teeny bit more oil and
add the carrots right in the center
so once the carrots have been in for
about a minute then you can add your
scallions so you want to make sure that
with whatever vegetables you're using
that none of your vegetables are wet
from washing make sure you dry them
thoroughly because all of that excess
moisture will cool down your wok and
encourage again that's steaming instead
of getting that nice steer that you're
looking for with a surprise the
vegetables should be crisp tender
not too soft and now I'm going to add
back the pork in all of the aromatics
now you want to make sure that if there
are any juices left that you add those
as well because that will end up being
your stir-fry sauce here so this looks
good it smells so great and of course
what do you want to serve your stir-fry
with well how about some nice long grain
rice I'm using jasmine rice here so
there you go guys
there's no need to order takeout and no
need to fear stir frying at home with
these tricks and tips I promise you
you'll have success with whatever
vegetables or meats you decide to try
enjoy guys
